title: How to Get Into Your House Quickly

steps.headline: Have your keys out before you get to your home.
steps.description: It is important for anyone in any neighborhood to have keys ready before they enter the home. Get your gate and main door key ready about a block away from the home.

steps.headline: If you think someone is following you, follow these steps inside this article -> (https://www.wikihow.com/Protect-Yourself-if-Someone's-Following-You-Home).
steps.description: This article is made for people who realize that they are being followed when it's too late.

steps.headline: Do not go in through back doors or alleyways.
steps.description: Often, people make the mistake of doing this. It is important to go through you front door as it is on a major street and people are more likely to hear you scream.

steps.headline: Examine shadows.
steps.description: When it is dark, people leave shadows both behind and in-front of them. It is important to examine these shadows. As a general rule of thumb, if there are more than two shadows in front or to the side of you and the shadow behind you is larger, that means someone is behind you.

steps.headline: Throw something at your attacker.
steps.description: Put your key in the hole, turn the lock, and abruptly punch the attacker and push them. This will buy you sometime.

steps.headline: Very calmly, yank the key out the hole and stick it into the next.
steps.description: Your attacker will be angry, but another abrupt punch to the face will keep them at bay.

steps.headline: As soon as you feel the door give way, go through.
steps.description: Your attacker will attempt to grab you. Slam the door as fast as you can, and crush their hand, then while the attacker is in pain, push it way.

steps.headline: Lock the door!
steps.description: This is the most obvious step. Lock both top and bottom locks.

steps.headline: Call the cops, and make sure your attacker knows.
steps.description: Look out the Keyhole, and see if they are there. Then open up all blinds in your house, get your weapon, and be prepared for the worst.

text: Have your keys out before you get to your home. It is important for anyone in any neighborhood to have keys ready before they enter the home. Get your gate and main door key ready about a block away from the home. If you think someone is following you, follow these steps inside this article -> (https://www.wikihow.com/Protect-Yourself-if-Someone's-Following-You-Home). This article is made for people who realize that they are being followed when it's too late. Do not go in through back doors or alleyways. Often, people make the mistake of doing this. It is important to go through you front door as it is on a major street and people are more likely to hear you scream. Examine shadows. When it is dark, people leave shadows both behind and in-front of them. It is important to examine these shadows. As a general rule of thumb, if there are more than two shadows in front or to the side of you and the shadow behind you is larger, that means someone is behind you. Throw something at your attacker. Put your key in the hole, turn the lock, and abruptly punch the attacker and push them. This will buy you sometime. Very calmly, yank the key out the hole and stick it into the next. Your attacker will be angry, but another abrupt punch to the face will keep them at bay. As soon as you feel the door give way, go through. Your attacker will attempt to grab you. Slam the door as fast as you can, and crush their hand, then while the attacker is in pain, push it way. Lock the door! This is the most obvious step. Lock both top and bottom locks. Call the cops, and make sure your attacker knows. Look out the Keyhole, and see if they are there. Then open up all blinds in your house, get your weapon, and be prepared for the worst.
